course_main_structural_unit.address:
Näituse 20 - 324
50409 Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: The basic course discusses the creation, legal nature and legal foundations of the EU, the interactions of the EU with international and regional organizations, relationship between the EU law and national law, institutions of the EU and the representation of Estonia therein, the decision making and law making procedures of the EU and Estonia's participation thereof, the implementation of the EU law in Member States including Estonia and the problems that might arise, the responsibility of a Member State in case of being in breach with the EU law, the judicial system of the EU and actions and procedure in the European Court of Justice, the fundamental rights and freedoms in the EU law, the general principles of EU law.
description.et: The basic course discusses the creation, legal nature and legal foundations of the EU, the interactions of the EU with international and regional organizations, relationship between the EU law and national law, institutions of the EU and the representation of Estonia therein, the decision making and law making procedures of the EU and Estonia's participation thereof, the implementation of the EU law in Member States including Estonia and the problems that might arise, the responsibility of a Member State in case of being in breach with the EU law, the judicial system of the EU and actions and procedure in the European Court of Justice, the fundamental rights and freedoms in the EU law, the general principles of EU law.

objectives.en: The aim of the course on EU law is to introduce the fundamental principles of the European Union, the institutional structure and the fundamental treaties of the EU, the legal drafting procedure and the judicial system of the EU, the relationship between national law and EU law. The course deals to a large extent with the case law of the Court of Justice of the EU (COJEU) as the precedents have an essential role in the EU law.
objectives.et: The aim of the course on EU law is to introduce the fundamental principles of the European Union, the institutional structure and the fundamental treaties of the EU, the legal drafting procedure and the judicial system of the EU, the relationship between national law and EU law. The course deals to a large extent with the case law of the Court of Justice of the EU (COJEU) as the precedents have an essential role in the EU law.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to create an understanding of the EU law as a dynamic process and the natural belonging of the EU law into the national legal system.
objectives.et: The aim of the course is to create an understanding of the EU law as a dynamic process and the natural belonging of the EU law into the national legal system.

learning_outcomes.en: The student who has passed the course is able to:
learning_outcomes.et: The student who has passed the course is able to:

learning_outcomes.en: - Explain the central principles of European Union Law
learning_outcomes.et: - Explain the central principles of European Union Law

learning_outcomes.en: - Describe the sources of European Union law
learning_outcomes.et: - Describe the sources of European Union law

learning_outcomes.en: - Understand the relation between European Union and national legal systems
learning_outcomes.et: - Understand the relation between European Union and national legal systems

learning_outcomes.en: - Identify the subjects of European Union Law
learning_outcomes.et: - Identify the subjects of European Union Law

learning_outcomes.en: - Find and apply the substantial regulation of the main branches of European Union law
learning_outcomes.et: - Find and apply the substantial regulation of the main branches of European Union law

learning_outcomes.en: - Solve hypothetical cases  of EU law
learning_outcomes.et: - Solve hypothetical cases  of EU law

learning_outcomes.en: - Identify collisions between the national and the EU law and find the best way to solve the problem
learning_outcomes.et: - Identify collisions between the national and the EU law and find the best way to solve the problem

learning_outcomes.en: - Understand and distinguish between different actions in the COJEU incl. preliminary rulings, judicial review of EU acts (action to annul and others), infringement procedure. Able to pick the right action in order to solve the practical case. Understand the procedural aspects and interpretation methods of the COJEU
learning_outcomes.et: - Understand and distinguish between different actions in the COJEU incl. preliminary rulings, judicial review of EU acts (action to annul and others), infringement procedure. Able to pick the right action in order to solve the practical case. Understand the procedural aspects and interpretation methods of the COJEU

learning_outcomes.en: - By passing the course the students will build up a ground for working with the acquis and an understanding of the legal nature of the EU. They also expand the sense of orientation in the information about the EU and the legal literature about EU, especially in the sources of the EU law.
learning_outcomes.et: - By passing the course the students will build up a ground for working with the acquis and an understanding of the legal nature of the EU. They also expand the sense of orientation in the information about the EU and the legal literature about EU, especially in the sources of the EU law.

description.et: A written exam in Moodle. Total of 100 points possible.

grade_preconditions.et:
*	Participation in all seminars.
*	A written exam with two questions worth a maximum of 100 points (a theoretical question for a maximum of 30 points and solving a case for a maximum of 70 points)

grade_evaluation.et:
Criteria
*	consistency, completeness and correctness of the answers to theoretical questions
*	creativeness and consistency of the solutions to hypothetical cases 
*	depth of the analysis of problems and applicable norms and principles
*	association of theory with state and court practice
*	structure and formatting

Grades
A	the answers to theoretical questions are remarkable; the examination of hypothetical cases is full, logical and creative; the analysis of legal problems is detailed and innovative; all relevant norms and principles have been used; the references to state and court practice are thoughtful and creative; the form is excellent; overall, the text is a remarkable achievement [91-100 points]
B	the answers to theoretical questions are very good with insignificant mistakes or omissions; the examination of hypothetical cases is purposeful and creative; the analysis of legal problems is very good with insignificant deficiencies; necessary norms and principles have been used; the references to state and court practice support the conclusions; the form is very good; overall, the treatment of the subject is logical and smooth [81-90 points]
C	the answers to theoretical questions are good, but there are mistakes or omissions; the examination of hypothetical cases addresses correctly the central issues; the analysis of legal problems is good with some deficiencies concerning specific issues; key norms and principles have been used; the form is good; overall, the coverage of the subject is logical, but there are some weaknesses from the point of view of the whole [71-80 points]
D	the answers to theoretical questions are fair, but there are several mistakes or omissions; the examination of hypothetical cases is satisfactory, but focuses only on the central aspects; the analysis of legal problems is satisfactory with deficiencies is most aspects; only basic norms and principles have been used; the form is fair; overall, the treatment of the subjec

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials:
Books
*	EU Law: Text, Cases, and Materials ; Paul Craig und Grainne De Burca 2015
Treaties and Documents. http://www.oxfordlawtrove.com/view/10.1093/he/9780198714927.001.0001/he-9780198714927 (21 Aug 2017)
*	Treaty on European Union
*	Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union
resources.recommended_materials:
Books
*	Publications from the European Law Review, Common Market Law Review, European Constitutional Law Review and other.
*	Other materials made available on-line during the course.
